headline: Pumpkin Spice Cupcakes
description: These perfectly spiced pumpkin cupcakes with a cinnamon cream cheese frosting are delicious in the fall, or any other time of the year.

video.description: These delicious cupcakes make any fall occasion special.
video.name: Pumpkin Spice Cupcakes

name: Pumpkin Spice Cupcakes

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease 24 muffin cups or line cups with paper liners. Sift flour, baking powder, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, cloves, allspice, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl; set aside.

Beat white sugar, Â½ cup butter, and brown sugar together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add pumpkin puree and milk; stir in flour mixture until just combined. Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each 3/4 full.
Bake in the preheated oven until tops spring back when lightly pressed, about 25 minutes. Cool in the pans for 5 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack and let cool, about 20 minutes.

Make the frosting: Beat cream cheese and 1/4 cup butter together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until smooth. Beat in confectioners' sugar, a little at a time, until incorporated. Add vanilla extract and 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon; beat until fluffy.

review.reviewBody: should have read the critical reviews
Easy and delicious

The recipe was so easy to follow. I wound up making them jumbo cupcakes because I just prefer them. I was able to get a dozen out of the mixture. They were soooooo moist and delicious! My hubby loves anything pumpkin, and he was standing right next to me to "lick the bowl, beaters, and anything else"...I put nuts in his six! The icing was beyond delicious!!! Didn't change anything.

Definitely more of a pumpkin spice flavor than a true pumpkin. Tastes a bit too artificial for me. But not bad at all. I do think the cream cheese frosting could use a bit of flavor tweaking. It reminded me of the frosting on a typical carrot cake. I think it could use more pumpkin spice flavoring. Overall not bad but most likely would not bake again. I think there are better, more true pumpkin flavored dessert recipes out there.

OMG! I made these for a Halloween party and they were a HUGE hit! They were light and fluffy and absolutely delightful. I used oil instead of butter, added the whole 15 oz. can of pumpkin and baked the cupcakes for about 22 minutes. I piped on the frosting, so I needed an extra 1/4 of the frosting recipe. If you just spread it on, you will be fine with the recipe amount as is.

I haven't frosted yet, but these smelled so good we couldn't wait to try them! They are delicious! I got 22 cupcakes from this mix, using roughly 1/4 c to fill wrappers. Also, I used Cup 4 Cup GF flour mix, and it worked great. Maybe didn't rise quite as much, but that's not a dealbreaker. Still yummy!

Delicious! I made 12 cupcakes and 5 jumbo cupcakes. Next time, I'll use the whole can of pumpkin puree because I had to throw out the extra puree. I only used 2.5 c of powdered sugar. My husband thought it was too cream cheese tasting, so next time I'll only add 3/4 bar of cream cheese. I also used 1/2 c of milk and 1/4 c of hazelnut creamer. I didn't notice a huge difference, so next time I'll use 1/2 of creamer and 1/4 c of milk. 12 cupcakes were ready in 22 minutes. Jumbo muffins took 5 more minutes. After putting on the frosting, I sprinkled some cinnamon sugar to top. Btw, the recipe makes a lot of frosting!
I was pleased with this. The cupcakes were moist and spicy. I served these at a fall party.
My 10 year old daughter made these and they were very yummy! A little bit spicier than we're used to, but still good. Even yummier with frosting.

Followed other suggestions and they were quite tasty. However I could not find anywhere how much batter to use for each cupcake, so I used the standard 1/4 cup, but it only made 20. How much batter does everyone else use in theirs?
Forgot the picture....
These turned out delicious! Next time, I might add more cinnamon to the frosting, but I wouldn't change anything else.
It was a very nice cupcake
I made the recipe, but I did not have the all spice and the ground cloves. I had whole cloves and smashed them. the cupcakes takes Great!
Absolutely delish! Only change I made was to add some chopped pecans to the batter. Will definitely make again!
Easy and fun, with a delicious outcome.I reduced the sugar for the frosting my nearly a cup and added two tablespoons of pumpkin puree which left a bit of a wonderful tangy contrast to the cupcakes.
perfect! absolutly perfect!!!
Made these for my kids Halloween get together and they were a complete success.

I make this recipe every year and it never fails. I did not have the 4 spices, but I did have pumpkin spice, so I use 2 teaspoons and I also dusted the pumpkin spice on top of the cupcakes instead of putting cinnamon into the frosting mixture.

Followed everything exactly for the first batch. It's absolutely perfect. Followed the suggestions for a lower temp cooking and those were fine but much preferred the original recipe. We will definitely make these again and again! The cupcakes tasted better as the days went by, allowing the spices to really melt into the desert. Lovely!
Love it. I couldn't stop myself from eating all the extra batter and frosting. easily 5 starts.
I make this recipe as is and am super impressed with these cupcakes!! The only thing I think could be better is the amount of frosting, not enough for me:)

As a rule, the first time I make a recipe, I follow the ingredients list exactly. After making these, I read some of the reviews, and Iâm not sure I want them to be any more moist, which seemed to be the top complaint: oil vs butter. They are delicious just the way they are. I did accidentally bake them 350 instead of 375, however. That might be the only change I ever make.

I used squash i had frozen from last year instead of pumpkin, and I added about half a cup more. I also baked it in a Bundt pan for approximately 35 minutes and lightly glazed it, but otherwise I followed the recipe. I was a little worried when I added the milk, because it looked like it curdled, but after adding the flour, it came together and turned out nicely. Very tasty, though I think it could use some walnuts

Great recipe. I followed the suggestion of oil instead of butter and buttermilk and texture ended up great- moist and definitely a muffin, also thanks to heaping tablespoon of baking powder! And I agree that being heavier handed with the spices will be fine and adds good flavor. Used only 2 cups of powdered sugar for frosting and it seemed to be still a bit tart- maybe 2.5 cups next time, but probably not the full 3! Def a recipe to make your own! I was worried and it worked out. Will be making these again throughout fall season. Also, 8oz cream cheese didnât seem like would be enough for the frosting but it was fine for 12 good sized muffins
Good easy recipe that everyone enjoyed. Made as is.
My family and neighbors loved this cupcakes. perfect just the way it is.

made the recipe twice. once as written (5 stars...so good!!) and once with modifications suggested (more spice, more pumpkin, oil not butter)...recipe still 5 stars. this is one of my fav cupcake recipes now. next time I modify it, it will be as a base for protein muffins and therefore will come out nothing like the original. so I won't be posting about that experiment here
Really great! Dense and rich. Definitely a cupcake, not a muffin. I loved the icing recipe just as much as the cupcake one.
This was Great!!! The fam loved it! I would just recomend making a liitle more frosting than the recipie said if you lots of frosting.
The cupcakes themselves were a little dry, but the frosting was phenomenal

Honestly this recipe is not good. My cupcakes came out dry and I followed the recipe very good. I will agree with one of the bakers, the recipe should use oil instead of butter. Affecting the moisture of the cupcake. Also the ratio of the spices is very low, I can hardly taste anything. The amount of pumpkin was low too it needs at least half a cup more. The recipe is not a good one.

Itâs very good and the recipe was easy to follow and was quite fun because Iâm an amateur baker so this was nice and the frosting was good though I didnât have enough cinnamon to add to the frosting

This was my first time making cupcakes from scratch and man, I absolutely loved these! I adjusted the serving size to 8 since I didn't have ground ginger, ground cloves, or ground all spice. All I had was a bunch of ground cinnamon and pumpkin puree. The portions for 8 servings made me 12 mini cupcakes. I was surprised they tasted good even though they were missing most of the ground spices ! Haha I did follow the recipe exactly how it said and they came out super moist. Definitely going to bake these again, using all the ingredients.
these were a big hit at my work party.

These are the best cupcakes Iâve ever made from scratch! The perfect moisture, taste, and texture for the cupcake and a delicious cream cheese frosting that did not overpower the cupcake with too much sugar.
My kiddos loved these cupcakes. They were light and fluffy. I added a quarter cup of egg nog to put a tiny bit more flavor and they came out perfect.

T
This recipe is a keeper! T
hese are delicious! That said, I used buttermilk for the regular milk and I had pie spice, so I used a rounded tablespoon of that. It was a little too spicy, so a scant tablespoon would be fine. Also used oil instead of butter. These cakes are soft and light. I topped mine with American buttercream instead of cream cheese icing-hubby doesn't like it. He sure loved these and so do I.
Made exactly this recipe. Didn't change anything. Cupcakes were wonderful.
These were a HIT. I used 3 tsp of pumpkin pie spice instead of the individual spices.
Delicious! The frosting is so good, just a hint of cinnamon. Everyone has raved about them.

This is a good recipe, but I wonder if the 1 tablespoon of baking powder might be a mistake. There's a definite aftertaste/bite that I associate with too much leavening agent. Next time, I'll cut that back to 1.5 teaspoons.
it was fantastic! They were a big hit cause they were gone in 2-3 days.

These are sooooooo gooooood!! And they came out beautifully. I wonder if there is any way to make the cake more moist, and make the icing less runny.. these weren't huge problems, just personal preference. Nonetheless, delicious!
These are delicious and easy to make. My husband loves pumpkin anything and these were a real treat for him!
Followed the recipe except I added the full can of pumpkin and threw in pumpkin pie spice for allspice. Turned out great!

I used the cake recipe (used my own frosting). The cupcake did not end up a light cake-texture... very dense... not very smooth. It was okay for a hearty breakfast muffin - yet not a traditional cupcake which is to be the texture of cake, just a smaller serving. The taste was good. Just not what was expected.
These were very good. I followed what other reviewers suggested like to use vegetable oil instead of sugar and to bake at 350* for 22 minutes and it all came out great.
I love this recipe is totally on my list of deliciousness

This is a decent base recipe but I had to double all the spice to get a good spice flavor. I also increased the pumpkin substantially (1.5. Cups). With those changes the cupcake was excellent. I did not use the frosting recipe. I made a cinnamon buttercream that was outstanding family pumpkin spice cupcake.
Excellent and I will make it again.

I would definitely make it again but I actually made a cake instead of cupcakes, you just have to bake it for around 45 mins on 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Best cake Iâve ever had, and its so fall its perfect. It was very moist and in the process of making the batter it curdled but it was fine and still delicious.
The only thing I changed was I baked them at 350 for 19 minutes. Super moist cupcakes!!
My husband said this was the best cupcake he's ever eaten. My 12 yr old son who will not eat pumpkin anything, ate a cupcake and liked it.
I made it for a friend get together, my family loved it, hope they do too! ( very rich, drank a lot of water after )
I didn't make any changes. These were fabulous as is. Couldn't keep my hands off, were the only problem. LOL
awesome cupcakes! Used butter creme frosting, but they all turned out amazing.
I made these as written and they were good but not quite pumpkin-y enough for me so I used the whole can of pumpkin puree instead of half and left out the milk.
I think they're might have been a little too much salt... but that could just be my taste buds not liking salt.
these were great, i made them for thanksgiving and everyone loved them.

I followed the cupcake recipe to a T. And I agree with previous poster that rating this recipe with changes is not a true rating of THIS recipe. I would have given this 3.5 stars if the option existed. My family and I "Liked it" and it was more than "It was okay". I did these as mini cupcakes (reduced the time to 15 minutes) and it yielded about 70 minis. I think I might try oil instead of butter next time. I'm fairly new to baking, and so I'm learning a lot by trial and error but don't know enough yet to get creative and try my own variations and substitutions. I did have to add more powdered sugar to the frosting because I over mixed and the frosting was too runny, but otherwise, I find the creaminess of the frosting as a good balance to the slightly dry recipe of the cupcake. In any event it is a hit with my family and one of my twins said it was her favorite cupcake I've made yet (and I've made quite a few!), so that's saying something, I guess. :D

These are DELICIOUS !!!! Just made a batch for our Halloween Party at work & they were devoured in no time at all, with requests to make more !!!! I did however read other reviews & made changes as suggested: used 1/2c canola oil in place of butter & 1 1/2c pumpkin(definitely gives much better moisture & texture), omitted cloves(not a fan) but increased all spices & salt to 1 tsp. The cream cheese frosting is wonderful... I only used 2 1/4c of powdered sugar & just sprinkled enough cinnamon to suite my taste. Going to make another batch tomorrow...but this time ...for home !!

Wow! These are fantastic! I took everyone's suggestions and doubled all the spices and pumpkin puree. I also used 1/2 the recommended amount of butter and then 1/4 of oil for moisture. I haven't finished frosting all the cupcakes (with the added ingredients made 30 total cupcakes), but seems like I will probably need to make more. I have tasted the frosting and it is sweeeeet. Next time I will probably reduce the sugar by 1/2 cup. Other than that, the cupcakes are so delicious and moist. They are very fluffy! I want eat them all.

Highly recommend this recipe! Thanks!

It was tasty but dry. I followed the recipe. They were a bit dry even after taking them out 5 minutes earlier than the time stated. Next time, I will take them out even sooner. They do not need to be in the oven that long.
Fantastic!
Delicious

I did not change a thing with this recipe and they were outstanding! I do use JUMBO cupcake papers and made 11 cupcakes. My husband said these are the best and loves them the way they are....but I might tweak the next batch a bit with some of the other writers suggestions ....just to see if he notices :-)

Loved these, but with some minor changes. I read reviews and swapped butter for oil. Also added more pumpkin (1/4 cup more) and doubled seasonings. BUT... doubling the salt, i feel was a mistake! I could taste the saltiness! 
I know i made changes but still... they were awesome and so moist!
I topped them with my regular butter cream icing with cin/sugar topping, as per my husbands request. Im sure the cream cheese icing was awesome too.
Great, great cupcakes. Frosting would get six stars.

You might as well skip the pumpkin because there is way to much spice. I used half of the ginger, allspice, and nutmeg and just a dash of clove. I also used half of the cinnamon in the icing. That should have been skipped altogether.
Addictive and I don't even like pumpkin!
Made for sister in law who absolutely loved them
My 11-year-old daughter made these and she followed the recipe completely. They were fantastic!
Delicious! I will definitely be making these again. Very nice and moist.
Added more spices and two cups pureed pumpkin. The Frosting was a little runny but super delicious. Will make again. My family devoured them.

OMG these were a huge hit at Thanksgiving. I was going to make pumpkin pies but when i saw that so many guests were bringing pies, i went searching for a great alternative. I wanted to make a bigger cupcake so i made 15 cupcakes with one batch instead of 24. Yum

I followed the recipe, made no ingredient substitutions and they are so delicious. A taste of fall on a California 85 degree day lol. I have a convection oven, so I reduced the heat to 350 degrees and baked for 20 min.

These are just the thing to start off October! I did read reviews as well and take that into consideration, made the following changes; baked at 350 for about 22-25 minutes. Used 1/2 cup I believe of vegetable oil rather than butter and left out the cloves. The frosting I followed exactly and best cream cheese frosting Iâve made to date! Very happy with the results will be making again!
1 teaspoon more cinnamon in the frosting tastes very good
I reduced the heat and they turned out good. Maybe a bit dry though.
My family loved these and asked me to make another batch as soon as the last one was gone!! Deliciously decadent for fall!!

I didn't read the reviews before I made these, but can now see that the reviews echo what I found. The cupcakes did not need to bake for 25 minutes and there is not enough pumpkin nor spices. Next time I will look at the advice in the reviews to spice this up a bit more. I didn't mind the texture with the butter.

These cupcakes turned out excellent. They are moist and donât stick to the cupcake wrapper. I did add chocolate chips and baked at 350 for 20-21 minutes and got about 20 cupcakes out of the batter. Overall, really happy with this recipe and will definitely make again in the near future!!!
I followed recipe. They are good but I think the cake could have more flavor. Maybe more of the spices. Still deelish tho. Frosting I an do without.........not a fan
Made these for my wife's birthday. She, and all of the guests loved them!

So light and fluffy! These melt in your mouth. I've made the recipe several times, and it usually turns out very good. I even had a little girl say these were her favorite cupcakes ever (heart melt!). I've both made the frosting in the recipe and used store bought to save time. The recipe version, unsurprisingly, is better. I'm not a huge pumpkin spice person, but these are not too overbearing in flavor, though you definitely know what you're eating.

I made this recipe twice, with the same basic changes both times. I used the entire can of pumpkin puree and heaping spoons of unexpired spices (I suspect the people complaining that the cake is bland are using old spices that lack potency). I baked for a bit longer due to the extra puree, but the cake turned out moist and good.

The first time I made this recipe, I used half that batter for cupcakes for my family and the other half as a small cake in a foil pan as part of a meal for a sick friend. The second time, I bake it in two cake pans and made it into a layer cake. All turned out great. 

It would also be good without the frosting as sweet muffins or with some streusel topping.
It is very very good recipe very delicious, i just put whippinging cream instead of milk, and in the frosting i put 2.5 cups of iced sugar
I added 1/3 more cinnamon. Still think it could use more. Cake itself was light and moist.

Followed recipe exactly, with just one adjustment: I subtracted 1 cup of confectioner's sugar from the frosting, as the texture was fine by the second cup and I felt 3 cups was too much sugar. These came out really good, but if I were to make them again I would follow others' suggestions and use vegetable oil instead of butter for the cupcakes, and reduce oven temperature to 350 F and increase bake time.
Followed recipe precisely and is very good cupcakes! Will definitely make again! Rated just four stars only because I'm not a huge fan of pumpkin.
Made these twice in one week. Perfect for the fall season! Simple & easy. I also substituted for plant-based ingredients once and they were just as delicious.
I made these with my own homemade pumpkin puree. Wonderful and perfectly fluffy. Sugar and spice and everything nice!
Delicious. I brought them to work and everyone said they were the best pumpkin cupcakes they have had. The cream cheese frosting is yummy to

Wow this is an amazing recipe
and the texture is flawless,although I would add less salt.
Yummy

I did change the oven temperature to 350. I wish I had read the reviews before I made them. Next time I will use oil instead of butter, and I will use the whole can of pumpkin. Maybe the yield will be 24, rather than 22. They do smell heavenly!! I hope my granddaughter's soccer team likes them.

I followed the recipe exactly as is and they came out fluffy, light and delicious. I read the reviews and decided to stick with the original recipe, because I think adding oil takes away from the flavor. I have made other cupcake recipes on Allrecipes and read many great reviews, with great advice, that has turned an amateur cook, into a "can I get that recipe" type of cook. The first advice is, use fresh quality ingredients. I recently learned from a reviewer that baking soda gets flat quickly, so I buy several small boxes and use a fresh one when I bake(baking soda helps with the rising). Second bringing the refrigerated ingredients to room temperature is very important. The third and most important thing I have learned is in the incorporation of dry ingredients with the wet ones. I use a hand mixer to mix the wet ingredients, however to incorporate the dry ingredients into the wet ones, I use a spatula since I don't own a stand mixer. I use the spatula in a folding motion until the dry ingredients are blended and there is no visible flour, this helps keep air pockets in the batter and what helps make them moist and light. the last thing is the time, do not keep them in too long, for my oven 20 minutes was perfect. I decided to look for this recipe after eating a cupcake from a local grocery store bakery, because my kids loved them. They said these are better than the bakery ones! Thank you for sharing such a delicious recipe! It was a big hit and I am baking several
These were a hit. I will make this again
